showcase.title: Front-End Web Development
showcase.description: I learnt basic front-end development with HTML, CSS and JavaScript through a course on Udemy, then used another course to learn a front-end framework, React. Through the whole process, I did projects on a site called FrontEndMentor. The site provides mockup images of a site, and users must code a site that is as close to the original image as possible. Users can receive feedback from other users in the community on the ways they can improve their code. Most of the projects showcased here are the challenges from the aforementioned site. Some of them are 'challenges' provided throughout the courses I took.

projects.title: Rest Countries API with React
projects.description: Built using React. The data is obtained through an API call to OpenWeatherMap. It has a light and dark mode that can be toggled through a button on the top right side of the screen.

projects.title: Project Management App with React
projects.description: After getting comfortable with Vanilla HTML, CSS and JavaScript, I decided to learn React. This project was part of a challenge on the course I learnt React from.

projects.title: Fylo Landing Page
projects.description: I wanted to try a full page website and thought this would fit my wants.

projects.title: Interactive Rating Component
projects.description: At this point, I wanted to try to do something more interactive with JavaScript and event listeners, which led to this project and the project below.

showcase.title: Backend Web Development
showcase.description: I learnt the basics of backend development with NodeJS. The projects in this section are mostly from course challenges. Note that the loading times for the project embeds in this section may take some time to load as they are hosted on a free site that will spin down with inactivity.

projects.title: To-do List with NodeJS, ExpressJS and MongoDB
projects.description: This is a project done as part of a course. It uses MongoDB to store and retrieve items in the list. When all items are deleted, it adds in 3 more items to show you how to use it.

projects.title: Daily Journal with NodeJS, ExpressJS and MongoDB
projects.description: This is a project done as part of a course. I learnt more about routing and practiced more implementation of MongoDB, as well as a popular third-party library for small utility functions, 'lodash'. The front-end was provided as part of the course materials.

showcase.title: Machine Learning
showcase.description: I have just started learning machine learning. I have completed the supervised learning section of the course I am taking, and am now doing some Kaggle projects.

projects.title: Predicting the Survival of Passengers on the Titanic
